articles.author: Ellen Zhang, Joe Cash
articles.description: China's factory output and retail sales grew at a faster pace in August, but tumbling investment in the crisis-hit property sector threatens to undercut a flurry of support steps that are showing signs of stabilising parts of the wobbly economy.
articles.title: China's economy shows signs of stabilising but property slump threatens outlook

articles.author: Anton Bridge
articles.description: The roaring success of Arm Holdings' (ARM.O) stock market debut makes it much easier for owner SoftBank Group (9984.T) to revert to its natural state - acquisition-hungry.
articles.title: Analysis: Arm's stellar listing sets the stage for more SoftBank acquisitions

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Grocery delivery app Instacart on Friday raised the proposed price range for its initial public offering, revising its terms to target a fully-diluted valuation of up to $10 billion a day after a smooth debut from Arm Holdings .
articles.title: Instacart raises IPO price range after robust Arm debut

articles.author: Elena Fabrichnaya, Alexander Marrow
articles.description: Russia's central bank raised its key interest rate by 100 basis points to 13% on Friday, jacking up the cost of borrowing for the third meeting in succession in response to a weak rouble and other persistent inflationary pressures.
articles.title: Russian central bank hikes rates to 13%, issues hawkish guidance

articles.author: John O'Donnell, Marie Mannes
articles.description: For months, Sweden's government has sought to play down a property crisis that has throttled confidence in the Nordic state, repeating a simple message: While some companies are in trouble, the country is not.
articles.title: Sweden braces as property storm clouds darken

articles.author: Elizabeth Pineau
articles.description: Apple (AAPL.O) said on Friday it would issue a software update for iPhone 12 users in France to potentially end a row with French regulators that ordered the suspension of the phone's sale due to breaches of radiation exposure limits.
articles.title: Apple to update iPhone 12 software in France to settle radiation row

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Multidisciplinary Association for Psychedelic Studies (MAPS) plans to file for regulatory approval for the party drug MDMA as a treatment for post-traumatic stress disorder in the United States later this year, in a potential boost to the nascent psychedelic therapeutics industry.
articles.title: Maker of MDMA-assisted PTSD treatment to seek US regulatory nod

articles.author: Joseph White
articles.description: The United Auto Workers (UAW) union said on Thursday workers would walk off the job at three Detroit Three factories at midnight, barring a last-minute agreement, setting up the most ambitious U.S. industrial labor action in decades.
articles.title: U.S. auto workers target Detroit Three plants for historic strike

articles.author: Andrea Shalal
articles.description: Rhiannon Hampson drives hundreds of miles across Maine's countryside each week as the U.S. Department of Agriculture's top rural development official in the state, and says she's never seen so many newly paved roads and rebuilt bridges as in the past year.
articles.title: Insight: Can Joe Biden and a fistful of cash win rural America for Democrats?

articles.author: Emma Pinedo, Fernando Kallas
articles.description: Spanish prosecutors on Friday requested a restraining order to prevent former soccer chief Luis Rubiales approaching national team player Jenni Hermoso, as he appeared in court to be investigated for sexual assault for kissing her on the lips.
articles.title: Restraining order requested as ex-Spain soccer boss testifies in assault probe
